meanings.definition: A person who strives for flawlessness and setting excessively high standards for themselves.
meanings.sent1: Her perfectionism made her spend hours perfecting every detail of her project.
meanings.sent2: His perfectionism often led to him feeling frustrated when things didn't go exactly as planned.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's perfectionism reached new heights when she color-coded her sock drawer.
meanings.sent4: The artist's perfectionism was like a sharp knife, cutting away any imperfections in his work.
meanings.sent5: The perfectionism of the chef was evident in the precise way he plated each dish.

meanings.definition: The belief that perfection can and should be attained in all aspects of life.
meanings.sent1: His perfectionism drove him to constantly seek ways to improve every aspect of his life.
meanings.sent2: The culture of perfectionism in the company created a high-pressure environment for employees.
meanings.sent3: The perfectionism of the weatherman was evident in his insistence on predicting the exact temperature.
meanings.sent4: The idea of perfectionism in relationships can sometimes lead to unrealistic expectations.
meanings.sent5: The perfectionism of the gardener was reflected in the immaculate beauty of the garden.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be overly critical of oneself and others in pursuit of perfection.
meanings.sent1: Her perfectionism often caused her to nitpick every little mistake she made.
meanings.sent2: The perfectionism of the coach sometimes made the players feel discouraged.
meanings.sent3: John's perfectionism reached comical levels when he rearranged his bookshelf by color.
meanings.sent4: The perfectionism of the judge was like a magnifying glass, highlighting even the smallest errors.
meanings.sent5: The perfectionism of the student was both a blessing and a curse in her academic pursuits.
